Field Detail

NOOP

public static Runnable NOOP
A runnable that does nothing. Useful for use as the default value for optional callbacks.

Method Detail

asRunnable

public static Runnable asRunnable(Object instance,
                                  String methodName)
Creates a runnable that invokes the specified method on the specified instance via reflection.

NOTE: if you specify a protected or private method this method will call AccessibleObject.setAccessible(java.lang.reflect.AccessibleObject[], boolean) to make the method accessible. If you're writing secure code or need to run in a sandbox, don't use this functionality.

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied method name does not correspond to a non-static zero-argument method of the supplied instance's class.

asRunnable

public static Runnable asRunnable(Class<?> clazz,
                                  String methodName)
Creates a runnable that invokes the specified static method via reflection.

NOTE: if you specify a protected or private method this method will call AccessibleObject.setAccessible(java.lang.reflect.AccessibleObject[], boolean) to make the method accessible. If you're writing secure code or need to run in a sandbox, don't use this functionality.

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied method name does not correspond to a static zero-argument method of the supplied class.
